.
How a Claimant Establishes Extreme Financial Hardship
If a claimant states that they are experiencing extreme financial hardship and submits documentation to support the assertion, accept the claimant’s statement as factual.
Documentation to support the assertion of extreme financial hardship includes, but is not limited to,
an eviction notice or statement of foreclosure
notices of past-due utility bills, and/or
collection notices from creditors.
Important
:  A Veterans Service Center Manager (VSCM) may designate that a claim requires priority processing because of extreme financial hardship even though the documentation described in this block does not exist.
Remember
:  Append the
Hardship
corporate flash to a claimant’s record when extreme financial hardship has been adequately demonstrated.
Reference
:  For more information on appending the
Hardship
flash, see the
VBMS
Core User Guide
.
